The deals even include a free home charger and installation to boot.

To counter slowing EV demand, Ford is pulling every fiscal string possible in order to move F-150 Lightning and Mustang Mach-E units off the lot during its "End-of-Year Sales Event." On top of those deals, potential buyers will receive a free Level 2 charger with no extra charge.

Ford is sweetening the pot for prospective EV owners

It is now possible to finance a 2024 Mustang Mach-E at 0 percent APR for 72 months, a rare move in the period of post-pandemic higher interest rates. To sweeten the deal, Ford will discount the vehicles $5,000 under the sticker price. The 2024 F-150 Lightning also offers the $5,000 discount and 0 percent APR, however, that applies only to XLT and Platinum trims.

Likewise, lease deals are also a steal, and Ford is throwing in $3,000 in bonus cash on top of the $7,500 EV leasing tax credit for a total discount of $10,500 on the Mustang Mach-E. The F-150 Lightning sees $3,500 in lease cash plus $3,000 bonus cash for a total of $6,500, which applies to all trims. This is perhaps the wiser move knowing that electric vehicles depreciate faster than gasoline-powered cars. No matter which financial route you go, Ford still includes a home charger.

Deal breakdown

2024 Ford Mustang Mach-E

Financing: 0 percent for 72 months with $5,000 Bonus Cash, Complimentary Charger, and Installation included as part of Ford Power Promise

Leasing: $7,500 in Electric Vehicle Red Carpet Lease Cash plus $3,000 Bonus Cash, Complimentary Charger, and Installation included as part of Ford Power Promise

For more information on the 2024 Mustang Mach-E, click here

2024 Ford F-150 Lightning

Financing: 0 percent for 72 months with $5,000 Bonus Cash applied to Lightning XLT and Platinum, Complimentary Charger, and Installation included as part of Ford Power Promise

Leasing: Leasing: $7,500 in Electric Vehicle Red Carpet Lease Cash plus $3,000 Bonus Cash, Complimentary Charger, and Installation included as part of Ford Power Promise

For more information on the 2024 F-150 Lightning, click here

Final thoughts

Following the launch of the Ford Power Promise, the brand has taken steps to ensure a smoother process when it comes to addressing charge anxiety. Part of that means lifting the burden on installation costs so Ford EV users can charge at home.

Knowing it has your back makes it hard not to be tempted by these deals for a new EV. With electric charging infrastructure still not perfected, the next best alternative is a solution that makes it easier to live with.Â
